Prenatal Care

Prenatal care is essential for ensuring the health and well-being of both the mother and the baby throughout pregnancy. It includes regular check-ups, tests, and counseling to monitor fetal growth and manage potential risks.

What’s Included in Prenatal Care

  • Routine prenatal check-ups
  • Ultrasound and fetal monitoring
  • Blood pressure and glucose level checks
  • Blood and urine tests
  • Vaccinations and supplements
  • Nutrition and exercise guidance
Importance: Regular prenatal visits help detect any issues early and ensure that both mother and baby stay healthy throughout pregnancy.

Tips for Expecting Mothers

- Eat a balanced diet rich in iron, calcium, and folic acid.
- Avoid alcohol, smoking, and caffeine.
- Get enough rest and light exercise approved by your doctor.
- Attend all scheduled prenatal appointments.

When to Visit Your Doctor

Visit your doctor immediately if you experience unusual pain, bleeding, or swelling. Regular visits help ensure early detection of possible pregnancy complications.
